thread.title: NSW bushfires: Rural Fire Service issues emergency warnings as bushfires head for towns
thread.title_full: NSW bushfires: Rural Fire Service issues emergency warnings as bushfires head for towns

author: Kieran Gair
title: NSW bushfires: Rural Fire Service issues emergency warnings as bushfires head for towns
text:
NSW bushfires: Rural Fire Service issues emergency warnings as bushfires head for towns Kieran Gair email More 
As the state faces its worst bushfire conditions in history, residents across NSW have been told to seek shelter from out-of-control fires burning near their homes. The Sir Ivan bushfire burns near Dunedoo. Photo: NSWRFS Sort posts by 4:36pm 
Editor of the Mudgee Guardian Honor Elliott chose to leave her home at Goolma after the RFS issued a watch and act warning. 
Ms Elliott said the fire was burning 20 kilometres from her house. 
"It was too close for my liking," she said. 
"The smoke and the heat were quite intense so I thought it was best to leave." 
Ms Elliott was also concerned for the welfare of her dog, a 2.5-year-old blue staffy. 
"I don't think we'll be going home tonight," she said. "I'll be looking for a dog-friendly motel." 4:33pm Kains Flat (NE of Mudgee): Fire is burning under catastrophic conditions towards houses. Crews undertaking property protection. #NSWRFS — NSW RFS (@NSWRFS) February 12, 2017 EMERGENCY WARNING Sir Ivan Fire #Leadville https://t.co/uzQdTIyZsC S change expected if in Leadville leave now toward Dunedoo #NSWRFS #alert pic.twitter.com/n7nboxwHz2 — NSW RFS (@NSWRFS) February 12, 2017 EMERGENCY WARNING - Binalong Rd #Boggabri https://t.co/pFnepJbR1g It is too late to leave. People in area should TAKE SHELTER #NSWRFS #alert pic.twitter.com/G5Pf4XmomA — NSW RFS (@NSWRFS) February 12, 2017 
EMERGENCY WARNING - White Cedars Rd #KainsFlat : https://t.co/0ZBWhaOZFj People in area seek shelter now. Too late to leave. #NSWRFS #Alert pic.twitter.com/BAbP5gKnpx — NSW RFS (@NSWRFS) February 12, 2017 4:23pm 
Extreme and catastrophic fire warnings are in place across the state, as NSW faces the "worst possible fire conditions" in its history. 
RFS Commissioner Shane Fitzsimmons said Sunday's fire conditions were "the worst in the state's history" and could deteriorate further when forecasted winds sweep through scorched parts of mid to northern NSW. 
The NSW Rural Fire Service (NSW RFS) has issued emergency warnings for five blazes: At Leadville, near Dunedoo; At Kains Flat, north-east of Mudgee; At Beechwood, 50 kilometres west of Port Macquarie; At Boggabri, in the state's north-west; and At Dondingalong, south of Kempsey. 
Senior firefighters have described the conditions across NSW as "off the conventional scale". 
The Bureau of Meteorology has rated the fire danger in the greater Hunter, central ranges and north-western regions as "catastrophic".
